resources.string: Bluetooth is off. Press here to turn on
WioKey requires an active Bluetooth connection to provide extra security for accounts on remote devices. Would you like to enable Bluetooth?
Your device is not secured. Please add biometrics/PIN/Pattern to your device screen unlock.
Tap the key to add a new device
%1$s disconnected\nTap the key to select another device or try to reconnect
Bluetooth is now discoverable!\nWaiting to pair with a new device‚Ä¶
WioKey requires your biometrics for added security
Please set biometrics/pin/pattern/password on your device to use this app.\nOpen security settings?
WioKey requires your authentication to access your credentials. Tap to authenticate
WioKey requires a secure screen lock to protect your credentials. Tap to create one

Thank you for choosing WioKey! We will provide you here with some general information on what WioKey is and how it works.\n\nPlease visit our website wiokey.de or the About FAQ page for detailed information on how to get started.

We use your phone\'s native lock screen capabilities (PIN, pattern, biometric profile) to safeguard your login information. Because of this, we require at least one verification method to be active!\n\nRest assured, your biometric info never leaves your phone! Check the About section to find out more!

Your phone is recognized securely by your PC via Bluetooth without requiring an extra internet connection during the authentication.\n\nYour PC will send any authentication request over Bluetooth to your phone which will securely sign the request with your credentials stored in your phone\'s trusted environment.
Follow the quickstart guides on wiokey.de/tutorial and stay tuned for upcoming features like seamless logins (regardless of server side FIDO2 support), credentials secure back-ups, and much more.
The PIN must have at least 4 digits
PIN confirmation does not match new PIN!
PIN invalid! PIN is shorter than 4 digits.
Resetting PIN state failed due to invalid user verification or timeout!

Your android device supports storing your keys inside of a Hardware Security Module, or a Trusted Execution Environment! Meaning that Google believes that your credentials cannot be remotely extracted üéâü•≥!

We are a German start-up passionate about wireless connectivity on a mission to seamlessly and securely connect our users to the digital world. Join us on this path and find out more by following the links below!
How do you want to share the app?
Check out this interesting security key app (still in beta testing)\n
We are a young startup with a grand vision.\n\nSupport us by subscribing!
Which websites can I use the app with?

2-Factor Authentication can be used with any of the U2F-supporting websites. The complete passwordless experience is today only implemented by Microsoft and a few others. Stay tuned for updates on the FIDO2 deployment as well as our development of a FIDO2-independent solution.
Why do you make use of my biometrics?

Because of the sensitive nature of the information being handled, we leverage the native biometric security of your phone to ensure that only you are able to look and manage it. Your biometric data never leaves your device, nor do we have any type of access to it.
Can I use the app without biometrics?
You can always make use of pattern/PIN/passwords to verify against, but at least one type of screen lock verification must be enabled.
How do I add a Bluetooth Device?

First you need to make sure that your phone is discoverable, for this go to the Home section, click on the connect button, and then select + Add new device\n Then you must start pairing from your PC, for this go to your computer\'s Bluetooth Settings and click on add a new device. For more information on how to add a device you can check support for Windows, MacOS
What happens if I move my device away from my computer?

If your device stays within Bluetooth range(<10m), you will receive push notifications of any incoming requests to log in or make a new crendential. You can safely ignore these, as the app needs your user input to authorize any action.\n\nIn case the Bluetooth connection is lost, the app will automatically try to reconnect once in range, but this is highly dependent on both your device\'s and computer\'s bluetooth chip. If this doesn\'t happen automatically, you can manually reconnect by pressing on the connect button in the home screen and picking your preferred device.
I can\'t pair my device with my computer
Bluetooth may behave unexpectedly at times. Such problems can usually be mitigated by toggling the bluetooth connection on your phone and/or computer. One of them must be acting up :)
I am not receiving a prompt on my phone

In this alpha release you need to make sure that your application is running in the foreground to receive the prompt. Depending on your device you can also get notification prompts with your app running in the background
What happens if I lose my phone?

You do not need to be afraid about misuse of your credentials since your biometrics are required in order to use the app. Restoring your credentials is at this point in time not possible, but feel free to install the app on a new device and register a new key. Your old credentials will expire automatically.

We store all your credentials locally in the native Android Keystore system. However, this does not mean that they are stored inside a secure hardware element. For us to be sure, we need at least one credential in the list, which can be generated in demo.wiokey.de.

 Once you have generated your first credential/dummy credential, the storage type can be seen here:
No credentials have been generated yet!
Keys are stored in Hardware! (TEE or Secure element)
Keys are protected by Software Encryption!
You can easily manage your credentials by navigating to the Credentials section to see all of your registered credentials alongside relevant information like creation date.

Backing up and restoring your credentials is at this point in time not possible. This is why we encourage everyone to follow the general Universal 2 Factor authenticaton recommendations and have a fallback secondary login solution that is not tied to the phone.

Proceed to remove and unpair host device %1$s, address: %2$s ?
For increased security, some FIDO2 authentication scenarios may require a ClientPin verification asking you to set a standalone trusted PIN as part of your authenticator.

Phone

 -Android 9.0+
 -Support for Bluetooth HID device profile (OnePlus and some Nokia handsets do not support this Bluetooth profile)

Windows/macOS/Linux

Please refer to this "FIDO compatibility list" for a list of compatible operating systems and respective browsers

Privacy Policy

 WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG built the WioKey app as an Open Source app. This SERVICE is provided by WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG at no cost and is intended for use as is.

 This page is used to inform visitors regarding our policies with the collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information if anyone decided to use our Service.

 If you choose to use our Service, then you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy. The Personal Information that we collect is used for providing and improving the Service. We will not use or share your information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy.

 The terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, which is accessible at WioKey unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy.

 Information Collection and Use
 For a better experience, while using our Service, we may require you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information. The information that we request will be retained by us and used as described in this privacy policy.

 The app does use third party services that may collect information used to identify you.

 Please check the privacy policy of the third party service providers used by the app

 • Google Play Services
 • Google Analytics for Firebase
 • Firebase Crashlytics
 • Facebook SDK

 Log Data
 We want to inform you that whenever you use our Service, in a case of an error in the app we collect data and information (through third party products) on your phone called Log Data. This Log Data may include information such as your device Internet Protocol (‚ÄúIP‚Äù) address, device name, operating system version, the configuration of the app when utilizing our Service, the time and date of your use of the Service, and other statistics.

 Cookies
 Cookies are files with a small amount of data that are commonly used as anonymous unique identifiers. These are sent to your browser from the websites that you visit and are stored on your device internal memory.

 This Service does not use these "cookies" explicitly. However, the app may use third party code and libraries that use "cookies" to collect information and improve their services. You have the option to either accept or refuse these cookies and know when a cookie is being sent to your device. If you choose to refuse our cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of this Service.

 Service Providers
 We may employ third-party companies and individuals due to the following reasons:

 • To facilitate our Service;
 • To provide the Service on our behalf;
 • To perform Service-related services; or
 • To assist us in analyzing how our Service is used.

 We want to inform users of this Service that these third parties have access to your Personal Information. The reason is to perform the tasks assigned to them on our behalf. However, they are obligated not to disclose or use the information for any other purpose.

 Security
 We value your trust in providing us your Personal Information, thus we are striving to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. But remember that no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

 Links to Other Sites
 This Service may contain links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.

 Children‚Äôs Privacy
 These Services do not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13. In the case we discover that a child under 13 has provided us with personal information, we immediately delete this from our servers. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we will be able to do necessary actions.

 Changes to This Privacy Policy
 We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.
 This policy is effective as of 2020-06-12

 Contact Us
 If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us at contact@wiosense.de.

Terms & Conditions

 By downloading or using the app, these terms will automatically apply to you ‚Äì you should make sure therefore that you read them carefully before using the app. You‚Äôre not allowed to copy, or modify the app, any part of the app, or our trademarks in any way. You‚Äôre not allowed to attempt to extract the source code of the app, and you also shouldn‚Äôt try to translate the app into other languages, or make derivative versions. The app itself, and all the trade marks, copyright, database rights and other intellectual property rights related to it, still belong to WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG.

 WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG is committed to ensuring that the app is as useful and efficient as possible. For that reason, we reserve the right to make changes to the app or to charge for its services, at any time and for any reason. We will never charge you for the app or its services without making it very clear to you exactly what you‚Äôre paying for.

 The WioKey app stores and processes personal data that you have provided to us, in order to provide our Service. It‚Äôs your responsibility to keep your phone and access to the app secure. We therefore recommend that you do not jailbreak or root your phone, which is the process of removing software restrictions and limitations imposed by the official operating system of your device. It could make your phone vulnerable to malware/viruses/malicious programs, compromise your phone‚Äôs security features and it could mean that the WioKey app won‚Äôt work properly or at all.

 The app does use third party services that declare their own Terms and Conditions.

 Please check the Terms and Conditions of third party service providers used by the app

 • Google Play Services
 • Google Analytics for Firebase
 • Firebase Crashlytics
 • Facebook SDK

 You should be aware that there are certain things that WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG will not take responsibility for. Certain functions of the app will require the app to have an active internet connection. The connection can be Wi-Fi, or provided by your mobile network provider, but WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG cannot take responsibility for the app not working at full functionality if you don‚Äôt have access to Wi-Fi, and you don‚Äôt have any of your data allowance left.

 If you‚Äôre using the app outside of an area with Wi-Fi, you should remember that your terms of the agreement with your mobile network provider will still apply. As a result, you may be charged by your mobile provider for the cost of data for the duration of the connection while accessing the app, or other third party charges. In using the app, you‚Äôre accepting responsibility for any such charges, including roaming data charges if you use the app outside of your home territory (i.e. region or country) without turning off data roaming. If you are not the bill payer for the device on which you‚Äôre using the app, please be aware that we assume that you have received permission from the bill payer for using the app.

 Along the same lines, WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG cannot always take responsibility for the way you use the app i.e. You need to make sure that your device stays charged ‚Äì if it runs out of battery and you can‚Äôt turn it on to avail the Service, WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG cannot accept responsibility.

 With respect to WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG‚Äôs responsibility for your use of the app, when you‚Äôre using the app, it‚Äôs important to bear in mind that although we endeavour to ensure that it is updated and correct at all times, we do rely on third parties to provide information to us so that we can make it available to you. WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG accepts no liability for any loss, direct or indirect, you experience as a result of relying wholly on this functionality of the app.

 At some point, we may wish to update the app. The app is currently available on Android ‚Äì the requirements for system(and for any additional systems we decide to extend the availability of the app to) may change, and you‚Äôll need to download the updates if you want to keep using the app. WIOsense GmbH & Co. KG does not promise that it will always update the app so that it is relevant to you and/or works with the Android version that you have installed on your device. However, you promise to always accept updates to the application when offered to you, We may also wish to stop providing the app, and may terminate use of it at any time without giving notice of termination to you. Unless we tell you otherwise, upon any termination, (a) the rights and licenses granted to you in these terms will end; (b) you must stop using the app, and (if needed) delete it from your device.

 Changes to This Terms and Conditions
 We may update our Terms and Conditions from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Terms and Conditions on this page.
 These terms and conditions are effective as of 2020-06-12
